trends: There have been 7 other sightings in Decatur
There were no other sightings in Decatur on or around January 26th 2007
Summary: Cylinder like object soareded by from westsouthwest to east/northeast.
divs: sighting detailsstanding outside by work location gazing at the trees and sky about 3:30 p.m. and saw object about size of loaf of bread speeding across sky on a very straight trajectory. thought it was a hawk at first, but object was brownish cylinder shaped, no bird features, moving way too fast, no wing flap, no variation in altitude or deviation from flight path. appeared to be fairly low, but perhaps that was an illusion, but no more than 1000 to 1500 ft. up. jumped up on a bench to watch as it went behind fence line and saw object a mile or more away taking a downward turn towards the treetops\rooflines. too small to be manned craft, some kind of monitoring device perhaps. possibly could have come out of pine woods across the street from my building....i can't say. there was something distinctively odd about it all and the smooth way it flew, like something from another dimension. it was very, very fast. i was excited to see such a thing and i've been out everyday since looking at the same spot in case i see it or something like it again. i've been going over and over it in my mind, telling myself it was only a bird, but then i think, "nope, that wasn't any bird." immediately after this, the sun started reflecting on some high cirrus type clouds to the south and prismed into a rainbow patch appearing on the clouds and looked like a portal into another world. this was just a natural phenomenon i'm sure, but the timing was most coincidental. i felt that i had attracted it, brought it out of wherever it was or that perhaps i was being shown something. i had been contemplating an orb i saw suspended in the sky two years back and wondering if our govt. could possibly have some anti-gravity, gyroscopic device which could hover stationary in a high wind...and that's when this cylinder appeared zooming by. pretty strange, but i am not one for making things up or hallucinating.
